messages.title: Will you help me get rid of the Tories?
messages.content: On 7th May you have the chance to change Scotland for the better. You have the chance to bring an end to a Tory Government of cuts and austerity and elect a Labour Government which will invest £1 billion in Scotland's young people.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will invest £1 billion in Scotland's young people.
Guarantee a job with proper pay & training for young people at risk of long term unemployment.
Increase college bursaries for the poorest students by £1000.
Provide a £1,600 Future Fund for every 18 & 19-year-old who is not at college, university or in an apprenticeship.
Make bus travel free for apprentices.
Raise the Minimum Wage and ban exploitative zero-hours contracts.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Banker's Bonuses and Pension Tax Relief
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will fund this by taxing banker's bonuses and removing pension tax relief from the highest earners.

mentions.tacticalSituation: A vote for any party other than Labour at this election risks letting the Tories back into power.

issues.economy: We will fund this by taxing banker's bonuses and removing pension tax relief from the highest earners. The redistribution of wealth across the UK is something none of the other parties will do.
issues.education: Keep university tuition free. Increase college bursaries for the poorest students by £1000.

images.caption: Leaflet page with a photo of Gemma Doyle, information about key policies and an invitation to contact or vote for Scottish Labour & Co-operative Party.
